intro: Inula eminii, commonly known as the Armenian elecampane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
